{{infobox character | people=[[Númenóreans|Númenórean]] | name=Beregar | image= | caption= | pronun= | othernames= | titles= | position= | location=[[Númenor]] | affiliation= | language= | birth=Before {{SA|771}} | birthlocation= | rule= | death= | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | house= | parentage= | siblings= | spouse=[[Núneth]] | children=[[Erendis]] | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Beregar''' was a nobleman of [[Númenor]], descended from the [[House of Bëor]]. == History == Beregar was a descendant of [[Beleth]], daughter of [[Bregolas]], of the [[House of Bëor]].{{WJ|14}}, ''(i) House of Bëor'', p. 232 He lived in the [[Andustar]] region of Númenor. Beregar married [[Núneth]] and they had a daughter named [[Erendis]], whom Beregar brought to the feast held when the son of [[Tar-Meneldur]] was proclaimed as his heir. There Erendis became enamoured of [[Tar-Aldarion|Aldarion]] and eventually became his queen. Aldarion and Erendis had a daughter of their own, and so Beregar became the grandfather of the first [[Ruling Queen of Númenor]], [[Tar-Ancalimë]].{{UT|Wife}} ==Etymology== ''Beregar'' could be [[Sindarin]], meaning "Fierce lord", from [[BEREK]] ("fierce, wild") and ''[[aran|ar]]'' ("noble");{{HM|GS}}, p. 344 or it could be related to the old [[Taliska|Bëorian]] name [[Bereg]]. == Genealogy == {{familytree/start}} {{familytree | | | BEO | | | | |BEO=[[House of Bëor|''House
